remarks.format:
## 解説 This class serves as the base class for all classes that represent event data. For example, the <xref:System.AssemblyLoadEventArgs?displayProperty=fullName> class derives from <xref:System.EventArgs> and is used to hold the data for assembly load events. To create a custom event data class, create a class that derives from the <xref:System.EventArgs> class and provide the properties to store the necessary data. The name of your custom event data class should end with **languageKeyword tag is not supported!!!!** .
To pass an object that does not contain any data, use the <xref:System.EventArgs.Empty> field.
For more information about events, see the [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/ja-jp/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f) article.
## 例 The following example shows a custom event data class named `ThresholdReachedEventArgs` that derives from the <xref:System.EventArgs> class. An instance of the event data class is passed to the event handler for the `ThresholdReached` event.
